ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved Chinese ability and gained greater fluency
Intermediate Chinese skills.
I learned a lot more Chinese, continuation from 130.
Chinese language skills, some knowledge of Chinese culture
Continued to improve my Chinese ability.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength is constant practice, weakness is confusion as to what grade matches what assignment and how they are graded (eg Lesson 16 grammar? Participation?)

Strengths: format, Liang Laoshi, assessments.
Weaknesses: repetitive (understandable)
Strengths- excellent teacher and lesson plans. Weaknesses- workload is high, but also this is understandable considering the class and time contstraints.
Very good course, engaging, rigorous. Level of rigor might be overwhelming in-person (for instance, if we were handwriting everything)
Again very work intensive, after finishing the first session attending class became a bit of a drag. But I feel it was necessary to offer the best opportunity to improve my Chinese.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: As a necessary part of the foreign language requirement, yes. The class is well structured and will help you improve.
Absolutely. The best way to continue learning Chinese in the summer.
Yes! The Chinese department is excellent.
Yes, if they genuinely want to learn Chinese.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Agree
Agree
